title: Pros and Cons : Vel'Koz
body:
Number 2 with this thing.
The number of ticks would represent how well this trait impacts the champion negatively or positively.

Pros +
-True Damage III
-Soft CC II
-Kite potential II
-High Damage III
-Good skillshot range II
-Fast stacks

Cons -
-Squishy II
-No escapes III
-Trackable stacks II
-Ultimate positioning is key III
-Aiming/timing is key II

Vel'Koz has high potential if used correctly. He hits hard if you are unable to avoid his attacks. Its easy to tell when to avoid Vel'Koz in the laning phase if you've caught some stacks. His R does massive damage through-out the game, but gets stronger late. Late game, his ultimate is on the lowest CD possible and has good base damage and has a very high ratio. You could argue by this point it is hit R to win, but Vel'Koz must stay still when doing his ultimate. Its not for a long time, but its a good pocket for assassins, especially after the preseason updates. Vel'Koz has true damage that is half of his AP. This allows Vel'Koz to eat anything that isn't incredibly mobile. This means you must be patient when killing Vel'Koz before you take up stacks, or simply dodge them.

From my experience Vel'Koz is a 8/10 in difficulty.

Pffftttt

Its against my ethics to disagree, but I believe you highly overrated his difficulty! His power per play expierience curve allows you to get to a high-ish level of mastery with a few games, but only increases slowly from there
True damage as a part of all champion kits should be removed leaving the only true damage in the game as ignite and red buff.

> [{quoted}](name=Kilanost,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EqvgmXzb,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-12-03T02:08:36.629+0000)
>
> True damage as a part of all champion kits should be removed leaving the only true damage in the game as ignite and red buff.

I personally dont think there ia anything wrong with true damage(flat) it's %max true damage that's an issue because you cant counter build it whereas with flat you can build more health.
imo velkoz really needs a team to protect him, that is the hardest part about playing him.

i wouldn't agree with 8/10 for difficulty. He has incredible range which gives him safety during the early game. His Q is highly effective due to its both direct and indirect trajectory. 

Most of his cons are shared by all mages. I would say Vel'koz is 4/10-5/10 max
I don't really think he's that difficult, I tried him out a couple times and even when you carry it feels like you aren't doing all that much (at least for me)
